title: Soulstealer Vayne
body: I just got a Soulstealer Vayne Shard. If I unlock the skin, how much $ would my account be worth?

replies.body:
Nothing. Accounts have no monetary value, and any attempts at selling, trading, gifting or otherwise sharing accounts is a direct violation of the [ToU](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse) and [EULA](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/eula).

EDIT: Still an awesome skin, though, in my opinion.

whilst that is technically true, people DO end up trading accounts on dodgy websites alot.

For arguments sake, the estimation would probably be around $15 for a lvl30 OCE account with only the soulstealer vayne skin and half the champion roster. This would obviously be higher if the account had other skins, had a full champion roster, was ranked gold+, ect... and lower if the account only has a handfull of champions, ranked bronze, had a history of negative behaviour or chat restrictions, ect...

edit: I do not endorse account trading. I don't see the worth in a rank if you didn't earn it yourself, same with the commemorative value of limited skins.

From what I understand, most of the individuals that do purchase accounts are the type who consistently get perma-banned, and they only do it because they just can't be bothered levelling accounts. Those kinds of people basically have no interest in "special" skins on the account, so even if we don't consider the fact that it's a serious breach of the rules (and, technically, illegal), there's no value on things like Hextech exclusive skins most of the time, so no real point (or worth, for that matter) selling when you could just use it yourself.

EDIT: That's not even considering that the account would likely get hit with a ban for being sold/traded in the first place, either.

I think it goes without saying that I certainly don't condone selling/trading accounts, I have a pretty strong opinion on that, and I just have to agree that there's no worth in a rank or "item" that you've not earned yourself through legitimate means.
